  • Method Details

    • onActionViewAll

      public void onActionViewAll(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws SQLException
      Loads all the Appointments in the homepageTableView, sorted chronologically in ascending order by utilizing the DynamicTableView.generateTableView() method. Loads the relevant Customer/Appointment buttons onto the screen.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the ActionEvent initiating the method, clicking on the View All Appointments RadioButton
      Throws:
      SQLException - when accessing the database via the DynamicTableView.generateTableView() method

    • onActionViewMonth

      public void onActionViewMonth(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws SQLException
      Loads the current months Appointments in the homepageTableView, sorted chronologically in ascending order by utilizing the DynamicTableView.generateTableView() method. Loads the relevant Customer/Appointment buttons onto the screen.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the ActionEvent initiating the method, clicking on the View Monthly Appointments RadioButton
      Throws:
      SQLException - when accessing the database via the DynamicTableView.generateTableView() method

    • onActionViewWeek

      public void onActionViewWeek(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws SQLException
      Loads the current weeks Appointments in the homepageTableView, sorted chronologically in ascending order by utilizing the DynamicTableView.generateTableView() method. Loads the relevant Customer/Appointment buttons onto the screen.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the ActionEvent initiating the method, clicking on the View Weekly Appointments RadioButton
      Throws:
      SQLException - when accessing the database via the DynamicTableView.generateTableView() method

    • onActionViewCustomers

      public void onActionViewCustomers(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws SQLException
      Loads all the Customers in the homepageTableView by utilizing the DynamicTableView.generateTableView() method. Loads the relevant Customer/Appointment buttons onto the screen.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the ActionEvent initiating the method, clicking on the View All Customers RadioButton
      Throws:
      SQLException - when accessing the database via the DynamicTableView.generateTableView() method

    • onActionAddAppointment

      public void onActionAddAppointment(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Directs the user to the AddAppointment page.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the ActionEvent initiating the method, clicking the Add Appointment button
      Throws:
      IOException - when calling the SceneChanges.changeScene() method

    • onActionEditAppointment

      public void onActionEditAppointment(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException, SQLException
      Directs the user to the ModifyAppointment page for the selected Appointment in the homepageTableView. Saves the Appointment that is selected in the homepageTableView to the public static attributes, 'selectedAppointment' and 'selectedAppointmentId' (which exist in the ModifyAppointment controller) for later access. Includes exception handling for situations where the user has not selected an appointment in the homepageTableView.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the ActionEvent initiating the method, clicking the Edit Appointment button
      Throws:
      IOException - when calling the SceneChanges.changeScene() method
      SQLException

    • onActionDeleteAppointment

      public void onActionDeleteAppointment(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws SQLException, IOException
      Deletes the selected Appointment from the database, utilizing a confirmation alert and presenting a message to the user upon successful deletion of the appointment.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the ActionEvent initiating the method, clicking the Delete Appointment button
      Throws:
      IOException - when calling the SceneChanger.changeScene() method
      SQLException

    • onActionAddCustomer

      public void onActionAddCustomer(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Directs the user to the AddCustomer page.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the ActionEvent initiating the method, clicking the Add Customer button
      Throws:
      IOException - when calling the SceneChanger.changeScene() method

    • onActionEditCustomer

      public void onActionEditCustomer(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException, SQLException
      Directs the user to the ModifyCustomer page for the selected Customer in the homepageTableView. Saves the Customer that is selected in the homepageTableView to the public static attributes, 'selectedCustomer' and 'selectedCustomerId' (which exist in the ModifyCustomer controller) for later access. Includes exception handling for situations where the user has not selected a customer in the homepageTableView.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the ActionEvent initiating the method, clicking the Edit Customer button
      Throws:
      IOException - when calling the SceneChanger.changeScene() method
      SQLException

    • onActionDeleteCustomer

      public void onActionDeleteCustomer(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws SQLException, IOException
      Deletes the selected Customer from the database, utilizing a confirmation alert and presenting a message to the user upon successful deletion of the Customer. Includes exception handling for situations where the user has not selected a Customer in the homepageTableView and situations where the selected Customer has Appointments in the database, as per the database requirements.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the ActionEvent initiating the method, clicking the Delete Customer button
      Throws:
      IOException - when calling the SceneChanger.changeScene() method
      SQLException

    • onActionReports

      public void onActionReports(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Directs the user to the Reports page.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the ActionEvent initiating the method, clicking the Reports button
      Throws:
      IOException - when calling the SceneChanger.changeScene() method

    • onActionExit

      public void onActionExit(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Exits the program.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the ActionEvent initiating the method, clicking the Exit button

    • onActionLogout

      public void onActionLogout(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Logs the user out of the program and presents them with the Login screen.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the ActionEvent initiating the method, clicking the Logout button
      Throws:
      IOException - when calling the SceneChanger.changeScene() method

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Initializes the Homepage and populates the homepageTableView with all appointments in the database. Determines the user's timezone and provides their local timezone and time.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - URL
      resourceBundle - ResourceBundle
